ARTICLE.TITLE: Algeria's mission to UNHRC draws international attention to the serious escalation of human rights violations in occupied Western Sahara
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Geneva (Switzerland), Sept 12, 2019 (SPS) - Algeria's Permanent Mission to the Human Rights Council in Geneva has warned the High Commissioner for Human Rights of the serious escalation of human rights violations committed against Sahrawi civilians in the Non-Self-Governing Western Sahara territory.

The Moroccan regime policy against the Sahrawi civilian population in the occupied parts of Western Sahara illegally occupied by Morocco would have a serious consequence. The Algerian diplomat added in his intervention

In response to the report of the High Commissioner for the 42nd session of the Human Rights Council, the Mission inquired about the steps the High Commissioner intends to take to ensure the implementation of the technical missions program to assess the human rights, grave and dire situation in Western Sahara in fulfillment of the commitments made many times over the years. Recent by the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights SPS

125/090/TRA
